question: In the 1944 Icelandic constitutional referendum, voters of Iceland were asked whether to abolish the union with which country or not?
explanation: In the 1944 Icelandic constitutional referendum, voters of Iceland were asked whether to abolish the union with Denmark or not. A two-part referendum was held in Iceland between 20 and 23 May 1944. Voters were asked whether the Union with Denmark should be abolished and whether to adopt a new republican constitution.
